SEARCH

Class BankManager

java.lang.Object
Person
BankManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
Staff
public class BankManager extends Person implements Staff
The BankManager class represents a bank manager. It extends the Person class to inherit personal information.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Description
    BankManager(HashMap<String,Customer> assignedCustomers)
    Creates a new BankManager with the given assigned customers.

  • Constructor Details

    • BankManager

      public BankManager(HashMap<String,Customer> assignedCustomers)
      Creates a new BankManager with the given assigned customers.
      Parameters:
      assignedCustomers - A map of customer names to Customer objects assigned to this bank manager.      

  • Method Details

    • viewCustomerInfo

      public void viewCustomerInfo(Customer customer)
      Displays detailed information about a customer, including personal details, address, phone number, and account balances. This method prints the customer's identification number, full name, date of birth, address, and phone number. Additionally, it displays information for the customer's checking, savings, and credit accounts, including account numbers, current balances, and credit limit.
      Specified by:
      viewCustomerInfo in interface Staff
      Parameters:
      customer - The customer object whose information is to be displayed.      

    • processTransactions

      public void processTransactions(String csvFilePath)
      Processes a CSV file containing a list of transactions and performs actions such as payments, transfers, inquiries, withdrawals, and deposits based on the transaction data. This method reads each line from the provided CSV file, parses the transaction details, identifies the action to be performed, and invokes the corresponding method. It supports the following actions:
      • pays: One customer pays another customer.
      • transfers: A customer transfers money between their own accounts.
      • inquires: A customer inquires about their account balance.
      • withdraws: A customer withdraws money from an account.
      • deposits: A customer deposits money into an account.
      Parameters:
      csvFilePath - The file path to the CSV file containing transaction data. Each line in the file should represent a transaction with the required fields separated by commas.      

    • paySomeone

      public boolean paySomeone(Customer fromCustomer, Customer toCustomer, String fromWhere, String toWhere, double amount)
      Handles a payment transaction from one customer to another.
      Parameters:
      fromCustomer - The customer making the payment.
      toCustomer - The customer receiving the payment.
      fromWhere - The account type from which funds are drawn ("Checking").
      toWhere - The account type to which funds are deposited ("Checking").
      amount - The amount to be transferred.
      Returns:
      True if the transaction was successful; false otherwise.      

    • transferMoney

      public boolean transferMoney(Customer customer, String fromWhere, String toWhere, double amount)
      Transfers a specified amount between a customer's checking and savings accounts.
      Parameters:
      customer - The customer initiating the transfer.
      fromWhere - Source account type ("Checking" or "Savings").
      toWhere - Destination account type ("Checking" or "Savings").
      amount - The amount to transfer.
      Returns:
      true if the statement is successfully generated, false otherwise.      

    • inquireBalance

      public void inquireBalance(Customer customer, String fromWhere)
      Displays the balance and account details for a specified account type (checking, savings, or credit) of a customer.
      Parameters:
      customer - The customer whose account balance is being inquired.
      fromWhere - The account type to check ("Checking", "Savings", or "Credit").      

    • withdrawMoney

      public boolean withdrawMoney(Customer customer, String fromWhere, double amount)
      Withdraws a specified amount of money from a customer's chosen account type (checking, savings, or credit) if sufficient funds are available.
      Parameters:
      customer - The Customer from whose account the money is to be withdrawn.
      fromWhere - The account type to withdraw from ("Checking", "Savings", or "Credit").
      amount - The amount of money to withdraw.
      Returns:
      true if the withdrawal is successful, false otherwise.      

    • depositMoney

      public boolean depositMoney(Customer customer, String toWhere, double amount)
      Deposits a specified amount of money into a customer's chosen account type (checking, savings, or credit).
      Parameters:
      customer - The Customer whose account will receive the deposit.
      toWhere - The account type to deposit into ("Checking", "Savings", or "Credit").
      amount - The amount of money to deposit.
      Returns:
      true if the deposit is successful, false otherwise.      

    • generateBankStatement

      public boolean generateBankStatement(Customer customer)
      Generates a bank statement for a specific customer.
      Parameters:
      customer - The customer for whom the statement is generated.
      Returns:
      true if the statement is successfully generated, false otherwise.
